page.title: 08BUILDINGS ON ARNE PENINSULA
page.content: The oldest building,St.Nicholas' chapel,which comes under the Parish of Wareham,was built in the thirteenth century with a small nave and chancel under one roof with a porch and buttress.Services are held every other Sunday.The next oldest building is the eighteenth century School House which had one teacher and an annual attendance of eleven in 1787.Most dwellings were roofless during the Second World War when the peninsula was evacuated and used to lure enemy bombers away from Poole.The nine dwellings today include Arne Manor which is mid-Victorian,Arne Studio,The Old Orchard and a modern farmhouse near the church.The 100 acre farm concentrates on grassland and beef.Only a family farm could be profitable on Arne today. .
